Description: A terracotta cockerel-head spout broken from a flagon, the beak forming the pouring-orifice. The crest and wattles are well-defined and eyes prominent; part of the wall of the vessel remains. Hand-modelled and applied to the shoulder of the flagon. Red-brown Nile silt, with some mica. Overall cream-coloured slip, with red fired-on ceramic colour on the crest and wattles. A blackish dried deposit survives round the beak/spout.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. Excavated at Oxyrhynchus. Roman, second or third century AD. Comparanda: Near: Allen 1985: no. 133, from Karanis, dated third century AD; Petrie Museum uc48345, from Memphis.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3775)
